quote_first: Then with a tremor he broke the seal of the notice and began reading; he was a long while reading, before he understood. It was an ordinary summons from the district police-station to appear that day at
quote_last: at the office of the district superintendent.
title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote_first: We have three years of the past to discuss. Let that suffice until
quote_last: , when we start upon the notable adventure of the empty house.
title: The Empty House
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote_first: “Strictly speaking—wait a second—strictly speaking, my last round of vomiting occurred on July 14, at
quote_last: when I brought up my toast, tomato salad, and milk.”
title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
author: Haruki Murakami

quote_last:
he was sitting on the edge of his bed looking at his watch. He put it to his ear. Then his lips drew back from his teeth in that curious wolf-like smile characteristic of the man. He said very softly:
“I think the time has come to do something about this.”
title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie

title: And Then There Were None
